title: Move selected elements group to the end of its container

requirements.text: Move the four selected elements so they appear together as the last content within their current parent container, preserving their internal order and without changing any other parts of the page. The elements to move are exactly those located at these XPaths: (1) `/html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[5]/div[1]`, (2) `/html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[5]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]/div[1]`, (3) `/html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[5]/div[1]/div[2]/div[3]/div[1]`, (4) `/html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[5]/div[1]/div[2]/div[4]/p[1]`.

quotes: Yes this should appear at last not in front

acceptanceCriteria: All four selected elements are rendered consecutively as a single group at the end (bottom) of their parent container, not before other sibling content.
The relative order of the four selected elements remains the same as before the change.
No other sections/content outside the selected elements are moved, removed, restyled, or otherwise changed.
All user-facing text remains in English (no new non-English strings introduced as part of this change).

constraints: Apply changes ONLY to the four selected elements identified by the provided XPaths; do not modify unrelated elements or layout.
Do not edit any files under frontend immutable paths (per SYSTEM_CONTEXT).
nonGoals: Do not remove these elements (the request is to move them, not delete them).
Do not redesign or change functionality of the Share Link section, entrance overlay, gallery, header, message, quote, or footer.
